website_summaries.verdict: This wireless device connects to your smartphone to send feedback and vibrate when your posture declines.
pros: Connects to Android and iOS devices to aid set-up, calibrate device, and get feedback
Stick device to upper or lower back
cons: Adhesive must be maintained to continue to stick
Some people are able to use for up to 2 weeks
Some users have trouble getting device to stick for any length of time

customer_reviews.title: product works but unusable - garbage
customer_reviews.text: the product itself actually works and monitors posture well but stickers are cheap and weak, it keeps on falling! they have to find a solution, right now its total garbage. I actually contacted the company and they didn't offer any solution.
customer_reviews.author: gil pl

customer_reviews.title: It would have been fine if it stays where you place it
customer_reviews.text: Sorry but this thing does not stick for long and you constantly have to push or readjust it and at times it turns horizontally by itself and stops correcting your posture. It would have been fine if it stays where you place it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am a graduate student that spends a great portion of the day typing or researching at a ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a graduate student that spends a great portion of the day typing or researching at a desk. This product delivers the quality service as promised. Very sturdy and discrete. I forget to remove and accidentally wore it while showering and it continues to work. Very pleased with my purchase and highly recommend the product to others.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Max

customer_reviews.title: I received a used device!
customer_reviews.text: I received a used device! ... it still has hair in the device and the multiple-use adhesive pads are missing.
customer_reviews.author: David V.

customer_reviews.title: It's stuck constantly
customer_reviews.text: the device was working well and after 3 weeks, it became very stuck. It wouldn't detect the motion right away and would keep buzzing as if still in the bad posture, very annoying and not helpful at all. I contacted for help 4 and half weeks after the purchasing date, and they promise to let me return it but nothing happened. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won’t stick well
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept but the sticker won’t stay even if you put it in clean dry skin. When I swear, it falls off. It fell off when I was in church one time. Not good.
customer_reviews.author: AnnMarie T.

customer_reviews.title: it slips off
customer_reviews.text: you won't want to wear it very long for fear of embarrassment when it slips off at work. it's pretty much worthless because of how it is designed in that respect. if i didn't pay so much for it, it would be in my garbage bin.
customer_reviews.author: Nour Sharabash

customer_reviews.title: The product won’t stick on your back making it so frustrating
customer_reviews.text: The product doesn’t stick well. If you are ready to keep going to the wash room to take out and put in then get otherwise be ready to get frustrated. I have contacted the customer support which were helpful in the beginning and suggested a solution but it did not work and I have contacted them again with No response. Think twice before you buy it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It did not work like expected
customer_reviews.text: I really was looking forward to using this. I wanted for posture. When I bent over to pick something up. And I felt like it only worked when I actually bent over not slouched. And the tape did not stick it all. I was trying to find a way to rig it so I can wear it like a back necklace. I gave up and returned it
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Krantz

customer_reviews.title: After all these years of terrible posture, I now have hope
customer_reviews.text: After all these years of terrible posture, I now have hope. After 3 days use, back muscles are a little sore. I can't wait to see how it will be in 2 or so weeks of daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Heiskell

customer_reviews.title: ... how simple the device is but it comes with great customer service and does what it does well
customer_reviews.text: It is a little pricey for how simple the device is but it comes with great customer service and does what it does well. My only issue with the kit is it does not come with enough alcohol wipes and additional stickies.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Great device, Awesome app!
customer_reviews.text: After a few days using the device and the app, I have to say I see a significant improvement in my posture and also noticed my back pain get better as a result. The device itself is small enough and discrete (I can wear it under most shirts and during work). The app is simple and super easy to use and helped me stay aware and understand my training process.
customer_reviews.author: Kashia

customer_reviews.title: Might be a good product one day - if the current versions malfunctions don’t run consumers off
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t function after a few uses. This product is a first generation product that needs a lot of work. I’m returning mine. If it’s still around next year I might try a later generation or version.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Vertigo problem created after using it
customer_reviews.text: A few days after using the product I started feeling vertigo, after multiple physical and lab test the doctors concluded that the vibration of the Upright Go made a calcium stone move in my ear giving me vertigo and loose balance. It is been 2 weeks in hell with a vertigo problem and I have never in my life had that kind of health problem. I didn’t see any kind of warning about the possibility of having this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Rosita Thinks

customer_reviews.title: Super cool
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful, easy to use product. It exceeded all my expectations: after less than a week I already feel a change for the better! It's elegant and small, no one sees it under my shirt. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Omer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful product & app, but *terrible* unusable battery
customer_reviews.text: I noticed a big change with this app. I didn't realize how terrible my posture was/how weak my core is. I REALLY want to love this product. Super easy to set up, app is intuitive with no bugs, very accurate view of my posture. However, the battery is soooo terrible that it's unusable. They say it lasts a day or two, but I'm lucky if it lasts for more than 5 hours. It's not something you want to be constantly charging, especially since it's an adhesive and you have to keep changing/buying new adhesives. It might be ok for some people, but I don't have the patience to keep recharging it all day :/
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: Another thing that I did not like is that it has to be charged at least ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm trying to use it. I don't know if I'm doing it right or not, but it seems very hard to keep up as straight as the upright expects us to. Another thing that I did not like is that it has to be charged at least once a day. I was expecting to wear it all day long, but it is not possible neither recomended.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Wuilleumier

customer_reviews.title: Great idea and worked great till if fell off
customer_reviews.text: This item is great and worked when I had it. But, it does not stick on your body if you get sweat. It fell off and I lost it and they pads that you have to purchase all the time don't work. I almost lost it many times before I finally lost as it falls off all the time.
customer_reviews.author: J Hahn

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't pair well with Android
customer_reviews.text: I had limited experience with the product working because it didn't pair well with my Pixel 2 Android phone. It was variable in terms of it's ability to connect and after a couple days of patchy use I wasn't able to get it to reconnect at all (despite contacting the IT support). In the end I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: JCS

customer_reviews.title: Its impossible to connect
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for ten weeks now, and I never use it. It just NEVER connects. Its such a hassle, I end up giving up. I have a samsung 9.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella Arroyo

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 5 days and will be returning.
customer_reviews.text: This is a product with great potential but not ready for prime time. The product was not what I thought it would be but I was willing to give it a try. After just five days the app would no longer synch with the device making the device worthless. I checked everything it said to check. The device was connected to bluetooth but would not connect to the app. I will look for something MUCH less expensive and less "techie." The company claims a money back guarantee so I will avail myself of that guarantee.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce A. Goettsche

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable and buggy
customer_reviews.text: I have naturally awful posture, so I was excited to learn about this product, and ordered it right away. However, after a week of use, I was actually in more pain! The tracked you stick on your back is surprisingly painful to use, and the app seems to have a lot of bugs, as I didn't notice much in the way of notifications that I was slouching during the training mode, but would see that I was slouching a considerable amount of time when I checked the app. I ended up returning it and will have to figure something else out to improve my posture!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: It really works
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived fast and was packaged smartly. No waste at all which I like. From the very first day using it, my posture improved. Even when training is done (only few minutes a day), when on tracking mode or not even wearing it at all, I’m fully aware of my posture. Especially when sitting next to the computer, or standing while using my phone. I didn’t even realize how much I slouched. Thank you UPRIGHT!!
customer_reviews.author: Hagit

customer_reviews.title: It says new, but it came with someone's hair on it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a gift for someone because they clouch a bit and they were happy to see the box. As they were opening it infront if me, we saw small hair on the device inside the wrapping!! It was such a bad situation filled with disgust. Please don't buy if you care about hygiene.
customer_reviews.author: Akshay Jain

customer_reviews.title: Awesome idea, good app, but attachment could be better
customer_reviews.text: I am sad, I loved the product for the couple days I got to use it. It fell off within the first week and it is lost forever. Good thing the company reached out after and said they could send me a new one. It is a cool product but they need to figure out a way to make sure it does not fall off or has a safety mechanism to catch it or you need to be extra careful about it.
customer_reviews.author: EKG

customer_reviews.title: Know where your posture problem is before purchasing.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like such a simple thing to do. I suppose if I hunched at my shoulders this wold be a better fit for me but my posture issue is more at my neck leaning forward and it does nothing for it. Couldn't return it because I had tossed the box cause I thought it would be a great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Kauai Mama

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money, a towel between the shoulder blades would be more effective.
customer_reviews.text: This product has helped remind me to sit up straight, but overall I'm dissapointed. Bending over (even with spine relatively straight) counts as "slouching" so if you are doing anything other than sitting at a desk you can't do much until the "training" session was over. The device regularly disconnects from my phone without notifying me, so it's not recording my posture and I have no idea that it's off. You have to charge the device between each use, and my device takes about 3 hours.
customer_reviews.author: aurora hvidsten

customer_reviews.title: Company sells used products!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item, because I thought it would be great to help my posture. Like some other reviews said, I received a used one. There were a few hairs stuck to the machine and tape. VERY DISGUSTING! Quickly returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t connect with my IPhone
customer_reviews.text: . I used only three days and my GO doesn’t connect with my IPhone. Not recommended. Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.author: Noufer

customer_reviews.title: What a great product. I sit 9 hours a day 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow. What a great product. I sit 9 hours a day 5 days a week at a desk for work where it's so easy to slouch down in my chair and I'm always complaining about pain in my shoulders and lower back. The Upright has not only helped me to fix my posture but after a few weeks the pain is totally gone. I'm walking and sitting upright all the time now. And the device is so small that I forget that I'm wearing it and it always stays on. I'd definitely recommend it! 5 stars. Easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie LePow

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job
customer_reviews.text: This product does work well, however, as a dental hygienist it just isn't feasible for me to use on a daily basis. Outside of the fact that I'm leaning over patients all day, I'm also leaning over throughout the day cleaning and setting up my room. For me personally, something like this was a waste of my money. I was constantly getting alerts in response to my posture so I stopped using it after three days.
customer_reviews.author: Tara J.

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, but falls short.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the idea! But it seemed too expensive of an item to just tell me when I'm leaning forward. There's no way for it to tell if you're shoulders are slouching, just vertical/horizontal back position. The battery life also only lasted for one day so you needed to charge it every night. Not a huge deal, but similar "wellness" devices like the Fitbit last for days. After the 15 day training program, I'm not sure what you would do with it. It doesn't seem like a long term solution to improving posture. For these reasons, I ended up returning the device after a week.
customer_reviews.author: Kyanskie2013

customer_reviews.title: Works and is fun
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy using my upright go. I'm a consultant that works long days at a laptop from coffee shops. Now fixing my posture is a game I can play at work. It's more effective for me than trying to remember on my own or do stretches every day. It does slide off my back when I sweat, hot days, or when I sling my bag over my shoulder, but I've always noticed and recovered it. A cool gizmo and worth it for the value of helping to form a healthy habit.
customer_reviews.author: Torsten B.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is a valuable reminder for some of us who have posture challenges. Even when it's not in training mode, I find it makes me think about my posture more when I'm doing certain things. It was easy to set up and the first adhesive lasted for a month. As for durability, there was the time I forgot I had it on and took a nice long, hot shower before getting out and wondering where it was. Still on my back, and still working.
customer_reviews.author: Ordinary Person

customer_reviews.title: Tried a second time with better results.
customer_reviews.text: I decided to give the product another try so ordered a new unit. Much better results. Was able to get tech support and found the support to be excellent. This product worked as advertised for a couple of weeks. Then it would not sync with the iPhone. I tried everything that the help instructions suggested. To my dismay the product web site has no telephone, email or chat support for technical problems. I tried for several days to sync the product and then gave up and returned it, my only recourse with no heartbeat on the other end. Too bad because I was making progress with it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical, but this is a great little device!
customer_reviews.text: I sit at a computer all day and have been having some shoulder problems. I didn't realize how bad my posture had become until a coworker took a picture of me at my desk. Needless to say I was shocked at how bad it had become. After some research, I decided to try this device, and while I was skeptical, I can honestly say that after a week of use, it has really helped my posture. I still have plenty to work on, but I am definitely sitting up straighter, and I'm finding that my new, improved posture is becoming more and more comfortable and natural feeling. I highly recommend trying Upright GO!
customer_reviews.author: heather r.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Love this, I’ve been wanting this awhile. It vibrates a lot if you slouch every second but you can also manual change it to set every 20 min after you slouch so it’s not vibrating every sec but I leave it because how else would I fix my back. I think this is brilliant and I am very happy with it. It’s adhesive works very well stayed in all day, would would probably need to buy extra when you run out if you wanna use daily. Battery life is good I just charge every night when I go to bed.
customer_reviews.author: Darienne

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It helps the posture but as soon as you sweat, it falls and doesn’t stick back on.
customer_reviews.author: Fuentes

customer_reviews.title: Great way to start forming the habit
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the device for 3 weeks and find that I catch myself remembering to straighten my posture even when I am not wearing the device, without a painful reminder from my neck and back. Slow progression of the training is important. I noticed if I leave it in the training mode, it does the job, but, apparently, I was not ready and the back started to ache a little from doing too much of a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Simple but addictive product
customer_reviews.text: This product is simple, but amazingly workable and somewhat addictive. Is especially useful when sitting long hours at a desk. When you’re going up and about, it would likely buzz when you’re tying your shoes or otherwise making movements out of posture, so it is best to be turned off during such times. In any event, it’s a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Product works great. Gets you sitting up straight in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle F.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best idea ever for those of us who need reminders ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best idea ever for those of us who need reminders that we’re slouching. In my daily busyness I don’t realize most of the time that I’ve been slouching so the Upright Go is the best for that.
customer_reviews.author: Jaynne

customer_reviews.title: WORKS! But may fall!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product, changed my posture life. Unfortunately, I lost one as it fell off my back somewhere. I now only use it when I'm sitting in the office, still works great! It's hard to get your "set posture" right though at times as for me, it's quite different when I'm standing vs. sitting. But everything else about this product is genius and amazing, and well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only good for really heavy slouchers
customer_reviews.text: Unless you are a very heavy sloucher, I feel like this is a waste of money. The only time it really vibrates for me is when I bend over which is annoying anyway. For basic slouching though, I feel like it isn’t sensitive enough. I put it on in the morning before work and by the time I get home I’m getting alerts saying the battery is low. So it has to be charged daily and only lasts 8-10 hours maybe. I’d it wasn’t past the return window I would definitely return it because I find myself not really using it.
customer_reviews.author: Haras

customer_reviews.title: Get it!  Ive been recommending it to everyone!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a year ago with the original silicon adhesive backing, so glad they came out with a necklace recently! I’m using it every day now and it’s taught me how little I’ve been using my back muscles. They’re sore after using this! But my posture and shoulder impingement is much better. My one minor critique would be that when in walk mode the posture detector is all over the place, making posture correction difficult. It would be great if a software upgrade could improve the average angle during hard walking and alert accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Product was not in the box
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a scam as the product wasn't in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic device. Im really impressed with it
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic device. Im really impressed with it. Please keep in mind, this thing constantly watches your posture with a light buzz and sound. It will not let you slack. The easily annoyed and those who are not into discipline may not like it. It also brings awareness to the issue so you will eventually fine yourself working on your posture when its not on you.
customer_reviews.author: richard Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Personal Review
customer_reviews.text: I really feel as though this product is a scam. There is nothing wrong with the durability or quality of the item; however, this product has not helped in the way I had hoped it would. Therefore, I would not recommend this product and do not believe it is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: This could be a great product if it would last for longer than 10 hours. My days are much longer than just 10 hours. The instruction booklet mention the battery could last up to 2 days. Then an article I read contradicted that and said it would last 12 hours. When actually using I received a low battery, 10% remaining alert after only 9 hours 45 minutes. Even now, after using for 1 hour I'm at 90% battery. (which means 10 hours...) This would be a great product. I'm much prefer button cell batteries that would last longer and need replacement than only getting 10 hours use out of a charge....
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Makes You Sit Up And Pay Attention
customer_reviews.text: I definitely notice a difference in my posture when I wear this. What's even better is that when I take it off I still pay more attention to my posture than if I never used it. It's great for wearing all day in "tracking" mode as it will buzz after a minimum of five minutes of prolonged slouching. If you are using the "training" setting it has enough flexibility that it can be as annoying or passive as you like. However, if you do wear it all day every day you will have to charge it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Cranny

customer_reviews.title: Loud buzz. Not flexible to allow movement in my job.
customer_reviews.text: I’m disappointed because this thing buzzes all the time when I work and won’t allow me to move for brief periods without buzzing. The buzz is loud so it’s heard in a quiet room which is usually how I work so that’s also annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: filthy secon hand goods delivered
customer_reviews.text: i was very excited and super impressed to receivemy package so quickly delivered to Africa! on opening up my brand new uprght & go, i noticed that the skin adhesive has been used, and came with complimentary body hair stuck to it (far darker and longer than anything i could wish to cultivate). to return this product to reach the US in time is WELL out of the allowed budget. i am so disappointed, a little revulsed and totally perplexed as to how this would even happen. shafters, perhaps with good posture, but SHAFTERS none the less.
customer_reviews.author: taryn

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed - difficult to carry around!
customer_reviews.text: The zipper on the carrying case no longer works because the case is quite small and the zipper initially had problems making it around the square case a square, and now it won't close up to keep the unit enclosed. I'm afraid of it getting lost. The tape will last for 10+ uses, but without a case to protect the unit and keep lint/dust off the tape, it will not be reusable for long!
customer_reviews.author: On-line Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly, lots of bugs, more annoying that anything else
customer_reviews.text: Having an alarm on your phone will honestly be a much cheaper alternative to this. I used this and the sticky pad already dried out on the first day. The battery also did not last through a regular 8 hour work day. It’s hard to position in order to figure out where will best work for the area you “hunch” the most. All it does is just vibrate, keep your money, and put alarms on your phone, or if you have a smart watch, that’ll do the exact same job but on your wrist as a reminder.
customer_reviews.author: Alex C.

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it if looking to improve posture!
customer_reviews.text: I use this device at work every day and after two weeks I find myself sitting/standing with better posture. This device is a great little reminder of what your posture should be and when it is not, you receive a little buzz. When I am not wearing the device, I find myself naturally sitting/standing with better posture. However, I still have a long way to go and will continue to wear the device for at least a month.
customer_reviews.author: Schloops

customer_reviews.title: Great Concept...Tough to Execute
customer_reviews.text: The software app and actual module are very good. However, keeping it attached to your body is pretty much impossible. The adhesive pad is great for about an hour until your body breathes or perspires. Then it will fall off. Your alternative is to find some form of adhesive that is closer to medical tape. Otherwise, it will fall down your back and possibly be lost. I almost lost mine three times before deciding to return it. Hopefully, they find some form of remedy for this, as I can see the value of using it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Gersh

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t what I was expecting at all. Once you get out of training mode, it doesn’t vibrate to correct your posture! It simply gives you a report at the end of the day or end of you wearing it showing you how your posture was. What good does that do... it defeats the whole purpose of the device. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: AKN

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for posture training
customer_reviews.text: At first I found this product difficult to get used to but that showed me that I really needed it. I didn't notice a difference right away, but after about 2 weeks of daily use, I found myself thinking about sitting up straight when driving or walking even when I was not wearing it. So ultimately it did help me somewhat. You can definitely not wear it for an extended amount of time when moving/walking. I found that after a steady 15 min walk, the adhesive would start getting lose. But would recommend it if you sit at a desk or in a car a lot.
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: Probably great but fell off the first time I wore it. Lost $70:(
customer_reviews.text: I think this would be great. Only got to use it once to practice and it worked really great. Nice app too. However the next day when I wore it it fell off and so I lost it. Looked every where. No way to track. The customer service people are super nice and great response. They did offer to give me a 30% discount off another one but after losing $70 without getting to actually use it I just didn’t feel confident to invest in again. Great idea. Great quality. Need body super glue though to stay on. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: T. Goudy

customer_reviews.title: Didn't like it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great concept and would actually work for people hunched over, as long as you can stand the weird vibration. After wearing it for only an hour, when I took it off, it was like I could still feel it on my back for the rest of the day. I have to lean over a lot to get things, so it was constantly vibrating. I just didn't like the feel of it.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what it claims to do. If I start to slouch, it vibrates to let me know. However, I think a shock collar would be more fitting for my situation. I have terrible posture and it's causing back and neck pain. I don't want something to kindly remind me that I'm slouching, I want something that punishes me for it. I'm not crazy about the adhesives. They work pretty well but are expensive. You might as well call it a subscription plan. Overall, I'm better with it than without it. If you're experiencing neck and back pain from computer use, I suggest looking in to this.
customer_reviews.author: Zdynobeat

customer_reviews.title: Top notch device!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this device for a few weeks now and find it a first rate product in every way. From the packaging, to the quality and feel of the device, I really do not understand other reviewers giving it and the Upright staff anything but the highest marks. The instruction video, and the tips and hints arriving via email, are also very beneficial. Happy I bought.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B. Trevathan

customer_reviews.title: Keep it in the training mode for best results
customer_reviews.text: Upright Go helped me to maintain better posture and reduce my neck and back pain. Keep it in the training mode, so you'd get a buzz every time your posture deteriorates. I wear it with a 'necklace', which I bought on the company's web site. It's a bit ugly, but I do not have to worry about loosing the gizmo. I've considered getting a newer model, but decided against it. I do not seen any major improvements. Also so not install their free desktop app. It has some nice features, but it's very buggy and hard to uninstall.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this device. I have poor posture and suffer from herniated disks in my neck. I was wearing a posture brace at suggestion if my physical therapist but unless you are walking or sitting for long periods those braces can be a nuisances. I have to bend at work or when I’m home with my children and found myself constantly having it loosen to straps and retighten. This is perfect solution.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole C

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The device initially worked well, but the second day it would not connect to the app. I spent days trying to resolve the issue with support. They were very responsive, but did not understand or read the trouble tickets I submitted. I think the system must be highly automated and stupid. In the end I had to return the product. Funny weeks later I recurved an email saying my issue had been resolved, and it included all of the conversation back and forth even the part where I told them I was returning the device. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Posture and Self Awareness are Key
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use; thought my posture was bad but learning its pretty good. I’m a computer a big part of the day and have an enhanced awareness now of my posture. Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: R. Penny Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Good for some slouchers
customer_reviews.text: This device will warn you if it is tilted forward. That means if you slouch forward at your shoulder blades like in the ad, it will work well for you. If you slouch with your shoulders alone, your lower back, or slide down in your chair with your upper back mostly vertical, or are lazing in a recliner, it will say your posture is fine, when it isn't. I wish it worked for lower back or other types of slouching, but that would probably require more than a single sensor. I'll stick with lumbar support backrests instead.
customer_reviews.author: zuzana

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I literally use the product twice. Now it’s in my drawer. The first time I used it after like five minutes it slipped off my back it does not stick on while working out. It’s a very expensive item to keep in my drawer. Should’ve returned.
customer_reviews.author: krysia j

customer_reviews.title: ... device for about 3 weeks now and am in love with it
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my Upright device for about 3 weeks now and am in love with it. I have had back issues for the past 8 years after a few births and years of bad posture, and this is the first time in all that time that I haven't felt the daily tension in my back that I used to have. The device really helps me keep my posture engaged and helps me put less stress on my weak back. I also wanted to mention that I found the instructions super easy to follow! This concerned me as I'm not so tech savvy, but I was able to program and navigate it rather quickly without too much trouble.
customer_reviews.author: OAB

customer_reviews.title: Only for certain kind of slouching
customer_reviews.text: Returned mine. This device only detects if you lean forward heavily (no matter how sensitive you set it). It can’t understand if only your neck or shoulders are slouching. You could be looking down on your phone for an hour while sitting on a chair —it won’t alert you. I wish it was a tiny bit smarter to understand shoulder/neck positions and alert on these too. It works ONLY if you slouch heavily forward with your upper body.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmet B

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Worthless! Place it on your back and as long as it is in place you’re posture is deemed fine regardless of you shoulders slumping! It was worthless to me!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crazy easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Only had for four or five days but I really like it! It integrates even more easily with the app than other Bluetooth type device I’ve used. Just a quick gentle reminder to straighten up. It’s fine in a group setting, no one will notice the buzz. If you are in a quiet space with one other person, they might notice it if it goes off-sounds like a cell phone on vibrate. I feel like I’ve been looking for this for years and the technology is finally here. My battery starts to warn me around 4pm and I put it on around 8am.
customer_reviews.author: J. Miles

customer_reviews.title: Support Staff AAAAA!
customer_reviews.text: My Upright Go purchased in 2017 stopped working after minimal use over the previous 2 years. Called the Support Team which quickly tried to resolve the issue but without success. Even though my Go was just outside the warranty period, they graciously offered me a choice of either a new device free of charge or a significantly discounted Go 2 (latest model). I went with the replacement option which was quickly shipped to me. Now that's what I call great customer service. A special shout out to Omri who couldn't have been more helpful and responsive. If you're looking for a great posture correcting device that's backed up by a even better Support Team this is for you!
customer_reviews.author: phil stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for neck as well. But not a cure
customer_reviews.text: This just helps you stay aware and is helpful. However, it gets really really annoying when you want to move around lot to..lets say to the fridge and rummage around for a snack or do your hair. I would have to go to the app and change the activity mode every time i get out of my seat and move around or sit back down etc. For now, this seems to be the only device out there to help aid my posture. So to sum it up. It helps.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Chang

customer_reviews.title: It works okay...until it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning this item. If the Bluetooth came disconnected from my phone (iOS), which it did every other day, then it was extremely painful to try and re-pair after several attempts at rebooting both phone and unit. The stickies that hold it to your back aren't great. If you clean your back really well with alcohol then you might get it to stick all day, but you probably won't get more than one use out of it. It was helpful to have reminders about posture, but it wasn't worth the effort and frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey F

customer_reviews.title: Decent product, overly expensive
customer_reviews.text: Having previously tried bio-feedback training that actively senses and vibrates to warn against muscle tension in the neck and shoulders, I was disappointed to realize that the Upright GO only senses vertical alignment. For that very limited functionality, I don't know that it quite warrants the price tag. Still, it does keep me from slouching to the side as much, and the app is straightforward to use.
customer_reviews.author: Janosz Dewberry

customer_reviews.title: Works well and even survived an accidental shower
customer_reviews.text: The Upright Go has performed as promised for me. I haven’t had any problem with the adhesive. What is interesting is that I had it in tracking mode and forgot I had it on. I wore it in the shower, even using a soft back scrubber, before I realized my mistake. It didn’t fall off, and it is still functioning perfectly, although I don’t know why, since it isn’t supposed to be water resistant. I certainly won’t do it again, but I do think it attests to the quality of the product. The case, stickie pads, and charging cable are all top quality.
customer_reviews.author: M. Glover

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for Slouchers!!
customer_reviews.text: The upright go actually works. It has a gentle adhesive to stick to your upper back (never hurts at all to pull off) and you set your own posture. You can change the setting based on whether you’re sitting at a desk or up moving around. In training mode, you get a very gently buzz (feels like a phone vibrating) reminding you to correct your posture. Within two weeks my posture had seriously improved- the go can simply track (no buzzing) and my stats improved daily and my back and neck hurt considerably less! Again, highly recommend this for anyone wanting to improve posture. I would purchase this rather than a posture brace.
customer_reviews.author: Cristyn Kelly

customer_reviews.title: corrected my posture and helped my shoulder pain
customer_reviews.text: So far, it's been a great help. It was recommended to me by my chiropractor. I went in for a shoulder pain due to repetitive motion injury. She said that I need to correct my hunched posture because between that and my scanning position (I am an ultrasound technician), I was pinching tendons in my shoulder. In the week or two that I was wearing it combined with specific stretches for my upper back and shoulders, the pain had reduced significantly to where I can go back to my workouts!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia G. Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Neck and backaches are gone!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love how accurate this is. When I drop my head to browse on my phone or hunch my shoulders forward when typing it vibrates to let me know my posture is terrible. It’s very helpful to having the tracking feature so I can see how I move throughout the day when it doesn’t remind me to sit or stand straight. It’s amazing how much better my back feels when I have better posture!
customer_reviews.author: kay

customer_reviews.title: Works Surprisingly Well
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews I was a little leery of buying this, but I have been pleasantly surprised. I’ve been using it for two weeks, and have discovered my posture has gotten considerably better even when not using the device. The battery life could be longer, but I’ve made it work. I’ve been able to get a couple of days out of the adhesive. I’m buying a second device for my daughter to use.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay B. Wolsey

customer_reviews.title: It works but kinda annoying
customer_reviews.text: The vibration's noise was quite irritating when you have to temporarily bend your back to reach something. But other than that, it works well and did fix my back.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H

customer_reviews.title: Five Out of Five Stars!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent item! Highly recommend it. Great battery life. This was executed very well. Support this beautiful and innovative Israeli company while watching your posture!
customer_reviews.author: ATCG

customer_reviews.title: Only works with iPhone
customer_reviews.text: You need an iPhone to use this device Dont waste your time if you own an Android device
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reminds about slouching
customer_reviews.text: I have always dreamed to have a "reminder" about my wrong posture. Usually my Mom pokes when I forget to stand or sit straight. But how about the time when she is not around? So I was so excited when I found this - finally my mothers' nagging can be replaced with a buzz from a small device attached to me. :) Hopefully this will help me to train myself not to slouch.
customer_reviews.author: NT

customer_reviews.title: Expensive and buzzy level.
customer_reviews.text: This got 3 stars because it’s like a sticky gyroscope. I had to reposition it from standing to sitting bc it would constantly think I was slouching when I was sitting upright at my desk. It did, however, help me see just how straight my spine was in yoga class for a wide leg forward fold, but other than that, it didn’t help much other than to make my erector muscles cramp up, which pulled on my SI joint. So, I’ve spent two weeks relaxing the muscles again.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: My new best friend
customer_reviews.text: For as long as I remember I had a problem with sitting straight while I’m working or studying. This little thing is a miracle who ever came up with this idea, God bless you. today is the 3rd day in my life I was able to have a right posture for at least half day or as long as I keep this little thing on. I am telling everyone at work and social media basically free advertise because I like to help people find this. The ONLY thing I concern is the tape behind it not as strong as I would like to be but compare to the benefits it’s nothing. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful little device!
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this for the obvious reason, my posture was poor and I was afraid of getting old and becoming a hunchback. I’ve had it for a few months and have really enjoyed it so far. It’s super easy to use and the app is wonderful. Whenever it senses you slouching, it vibrates quickly and definitely makes you pop right back up to a better position. After only an hour or so, my upper back muscles were sore because they hadn’t been properly used in quite some time. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Does what it advertises
customer_reviews.text: Small and comfortable device. Simple to use. The posture trainer does a good job reminding me when I am slouching and opened my eyes to how much I need to straighten up my posture. Cons - I have to recharge daily, wish the battery life was longer for those times I forget. Would be nice to have a cover over the sticky adhesive while it’s charging or not in use. Would like the vibration sound to be less audible...coworkers will look around to find where the sound is coming from if you have it on training mode in the office lol
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Need a string to prevent it from falling.
customer_reviews.text: Ineffitive, the zap is barely any zap can’t feel anything and it falls off after a couple weeks. I’m a sweaty person. Doesn’t stick anymore. Great idea but expensive. There’s needs to be a stronger zap setting and maybe a string to tie to neck to keep it from falling.
customer_reviews.author: MR. GORILLA

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t stay on
customer_reviews.text: First time wearing, made it through 8min trainer mode and then it was gone. All that money and didn’t even get to use.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Lamendola

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work as well as described
customer_reviews.text: I returned this item after 1 day of use. It seems to work as it’s supposed to, just while sitting quietly at my desk, but I had 2 issues. First, the vibration And sound is too subtle if you’re moving around or there’s noise. Second, it does say to not use it when you’re sweating. My office was a little warm, as I got warm, it kept fully off. I wasn’t sweating. The return went smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. KR

customer_reviews.title: NO NO NO
customer_reviews.text: WHat was I thinking? It was a novelty the first time that I wore it but then it just pissed me off... God forbid you bend down to pick something up... it buzzes. Maybe I need to mess with the settings... Not worth what I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Cavimom

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried the Lumo Lift without success. And I hated those straitjackets that would torture Houdini. But the Upright Go has been terrific - it's easy to use; the stickum is still sticking after 20 days (!); and the buzzing not only works to remind me to correct my posture, but I can also monitor it by looking at my iPhone or desktop I have no idea why there are complaints about customer service; I had some questions, which were answered immediately. It's a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Brustar

customer_reviews.title: Great (and smart) product.
customer_reviews.text: This unit works great. It absolutely reminds me to sit/stand-up straight. It has both a training mode and a tracking mode. I just leave it in the training mode, and it reminds me all day. The only (small) problem I have is sticking it to my back, trying to align it as the photos show. It evidently is unimportant if it is mounted crooked, but it is a nuisance. I suggest the next version of this great product be round, with the start button in the center. This way, no feeling of misalignment is even possible.
customer_reviews.author: Wardy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy a brace, get this instead
customer_reviews.text: If you’re about to buy a back brace, you should skip it and get this. At the end of the day, you must strengthen your muscles. This reminder has been most effective in my recovery
customer_reviews.author: Cristina Thackeray:)

customer_reviews.title: Really Like this Trainer
customer_reviews.text: When my Lumo Lift died, I decided to try a different posture trainer. The software with the Upright Go is much better than the competition, and their training program is excellent. Don't be concerned about the glue -- not at all irritating, and i have very sensitive skin. Easy to use, great for posture at work (they even have a desktop widget to help you stay "upright." Great product, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Pegawyn

customer_reviews.title: Having a perfect posture.  This Upright Go is GREAT
customer_reviews.text: Posture and it has improved greatly. Keeps me conscious to sit up straight and stand up straight.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Fazio

customer_reviews.title: You may get a used product like I did...
customer_reviews.text: Was super excited to get this product to start improving my posture, but was immediately let down when I found that I got a used product. One of the adhesives was already attached on the device and stuck on the case. The green peel off tags were already removed... I did not pay full price for a used product....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good, not great
customer_reviews.text: Would like a buzz/vibration every time I slouch and not just in training mode. Please add this feature. I spend $75 so i can have the gadget remind me, since I can't do that for myself reliably. Sticky things you send with it are useless. Adhesive needs to be better and sweat-proof. Other than that, cool little thing.
customer_reviews.author: Tast Tast

product_meta.title: Upright GO Original | Posture Trainer and Corrector for Back | Strapless, Discrete and Easy to Use | Complete with App and Training Plan | Back Health Benefits and Confidence Builder
product_meta.description:
Style:Upright GOUPRIGHT GO is a wearable device that trains you to improve your posture simply by vibrating every time you slouch. The UPRIGHT GO attaches to your upper back and gives you real-time posture feedback, reminding you to stay upright. The UPRIGHT GO connects to a mobile app (iOS and Android) that generates a personal training

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
feature_bullets: POSTURE CORRECTOR AND TRAINER: The UPRIGHT GO is a comfortable strapless posture corrector that you place on your upper back. It reminds you to sit or stand up straight with a real-time gentle vibration reminder. 8 out of 10 Upright users report a posture improvement of 92% in less than 2 weeks!

PRECISE INSIGHT AND STATS: The UPRIGHT GO wearable device attaches directly to your back for the most exact measurements and feedback. Use the Upright app for tracking and monitoring your upright vs. slouched posture. Plus, get a daily upright score and see your progress over time. Be the best version of yourself!

TRACKING MODE: The UPRIGHT GO can be switched to a mode with no vibration and is recommended once you complete your daily training session. That way, you can keep track of your posture throughout the day and improve over time. The UPRIGHT GO is not waterproof and water should not come in contact with the USB port. We also recommend against using the UPRIGHT GO during sweat inducing activities, as the adhesives are also not waterproof/sweat resistant and the device may fall off

PERSONALIZED TRAINING PLAN: The Upright app generates a personalized training program that consists of daily goals to improve your posture. These daily goals will help strengthen your back and train your brain to be aware of slouching. Long-lasting results and benefits!

WHAT YOU GET: In the box you will find the UPRIGHT GO posture device, a travel case, USB charging cable, 9 reusable hypoallergenic medical grade adhesives and a user manual. Download the iOS or Android app FREE. DISCLAIMER: The UPRIGHT GO is designed to alert the user whenever he/she deviates from a pre-calibrated good posture stance, by providing a gentle vibration reminder

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars2,197 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
specifications.Department: Wearables, Technologie, Sports, Fitness, Posture, Health, Wellness
